translated: Great Compassionate Invocation
According to the sutra, before one wishes to uphold it, one should sincerely recite the name of AmitÄbha Buddha three times. AmitÄbha Buddha is the original teacher of AvalokiteÅ›vara.
I respectfully invoke the moon-disc AvalokiteÅ›vara, with a vast, perfect, purple-golden body,
With a thousand arms always reaching out to appear in the world, and a thousand eyes of light always illuminating everywhere,
With one thousand two hundred mantras and mudras, able to fulfill the wishes of sentient beings,
With three eyes on the face, adorned everywhere, and wearing AmitÄbha Buddha on the head holding a jeweled vessel,
Proclaiming and praising the subtle Dharma of mantras, those who uphold it will realize the enlightenment of the Buddha,
With unobstructed eloquence, transforming humans and gods, being the foremost among the assembly of bodhisattvas,
Even hearing it for a moment can still destroy dust-like karmic offenses, and reciting it only increases the causes for attaining Buddhahood,
The power of great compassion is inconceivable, therefore I now always praise and remember,
Homage to the Great Compassionate AvalokiteÅ›vara, may I quickly understand all dharmas.

Homage to the Greatly Compassionate Avalokitesvara Bodhisattva, may I quickly attain the body of the nature of dharmasğŸ”½If I go to the mountain of swords, the mountain of swords will break by itself. If I go to the boiling water, the boiling water will evaporate by itself.
If I go to hell, hell will dry up by itself. If I go to the hungry ghosts, the hungry ghosts will be satisfied by themselves.
If I face asuras, my evil mind will be subdued by myself. If I face animals, I will naturally attain great wisdom.
